intro: Vangueria erythrophloea, commonly known as the red-veined vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has simple, opposite leaves with prominent red veins, which are a distinctive botanical feature. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in its native environment.
